abstract_summ: Therefore, social distancing measures, and social protection policies to guarantee the sustainability of these measures, should be implemented.Background After many jurisdictions have implemented intensive social distancing to suppress SARS-CoV-2 transmission, the challenge now is to mitigate the ongoing COVID-19 epidemic without overburdening economic and social activities.Our models suggest that social distancing interventions will buy crucial time but need to occur in conjunction with testing and contact tracing of all suspected cases to mitigate transmission of SARS-CoV-2.We investigate how individual protective behaviors, different levels of testing, and isolation influence the transmission and control of the COVID-19 pandemic.Establishment of guideline for workplace social distancing is needed and it would contribute to reduce disease burden of influenza, especially in vaccine mismatch year.We performed thousands of stochastic simulations of COVID-19 transmission in the Austin-Round Rock Metropolitan Area to project the impact of school closures coupled with social distancing measures that were estimated to reduce non-household contacts by 0%, 25%, 50%, 75% or 90%.
title_summ: Low-Impact Social Distancing Interventions to Mitigate Local Epidemics of SARS-CoV-2Easing social distancing index after COVID-19 pandemicA Decision Analytic Approach for Social Distancing Policies During the COVID-19 PandemicImpact of Social Distancing Measures on COVID-19 Healthcare Demand in Central TexasEvaluating the effectiveness of social distancing interventions against COVID-19Sustainable social distancing through facemask use and testing during the Covid-19 pandemicProtocol for an Observational Study on the Effects of Social Distancing on Influenza-Like Illness and COVID-19Effectiveness and Compliance to Social Distancing During COVID-19COVID-19 and social distancingSocial Distancing against COVID-19: Implication for the Control of InfluenzaEffect of social distancing on COVID-19 incidence and mortality in the USSocial distancing measures to control the COVID-19 pandemic: potential impacts and challenges in Brazil.Social distancing: A non-pharmacological intervention for COVID-19.Evaluating the Effectiveness of Social Distancing Interventions to Delay or Flatten the Epidemic Curve of Coronavirus Disease.
title_abstract_phrases: Our models suggest that social distancing interventions will buy crucial time but need to occur in conjunction with testing and contact tracing of all suspected cases to mitigate transmission of SARS-CoV-2.Sustainable social distancing through facemask use and testing during the Covid-19 pandemicWe investigate how individual protective behaviors, different levels of testing, and isolation influence the transmission and control of the COVID-19 pandemic.Low-Impact Social Distancing Interventions to Mitigate Local Epidemics of SARS-CoV-2Background After many jurisdictions have implemented intensive social distancing to suppress SARS-CoV-2 transmission, the challenge now is to mitigate the ongoing COVID-19 epidemic without overburdening economic and social activities.In the absence of effective antiviral drugs and vaccines, well-targeted social distancing measures are essential for mitigating the COVID-19 pandemic, reducing strain on local health systems, and preventing mortality.We used nationwide, de-identified smartphone GPS data to estimate county-level social distancing.Social Distancing against COVID-19: Implication for the Control of InfluenzaSocial distancing has been adopted as one of basic protective measures against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
